page.title: 07Housing in Harold Hill
page.content: The majority of the houses we found were terraced;they contained two or three bedrooms,a bathroom,a kitchen and one living-room.They were built in the early 70's:Most of these houses are owned by the G.L.C.,but some of them are privately owned.On first appearance the houses looked pleasant and well built.However during our survey we discovered that these houses have serious problems with damp.The G.L.C. were improvin them with thermal cladding insulation,they were also replacing the old windows with double glazing. We also discovered an old folks residential hall/flats.They were built in 1983 on the grounds of a school which was closed fue to falling rolls.They are self contained one bedroom flats with a warden and a general common room.
